name: SKT Maintenance – Coming Soon, Under Construction, Maintenance Landing Page
author: SKT Themes

sections.description:
SKT maintenance plugin permits all WordPress website admins to shut the website for maintenance and set short-lived page along with the authorization. This page can be modified with the plugin settings.

Very easily and efficiently personalize the appearance on every device. Add your background image, logo, add text, and desired colors.
Look out for all the features of the SKT Maintenance plugin to create landing page or coming soon page faster.

Using this plugin you can start customizing your website in private whereas your visitors will be able to view the maintenance mode page or a coming soon page.

Benefits, Features and Options:

  • Works with any WordPress Theme
  • Full-screen background
  • Upload your own logo
  • Configurable colors: fonts, background
  • Customize title, headline, and text
  • User login link on frontend
  • Eliminate selected posts/pages from Maintenance mode
  • Add Custom CSS easily
  • Background overlay effect
  • Personalize the appearance and functionality
  • Translation Ready
  • Multisite Support
  • Make use of WordPress Best Practices
  • Responsive and Mobile Friendly
sections.installation:
Using The WordPress Dashboard

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the plugins dashboard
  2. Search for ‘SKT Maintenance’
  3. Click ‘Install Now’
  4. Activate the plugin on the Plugin dashboard

Uploading in WordPress Dashboard

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the plugins dashboard
  2. Navigate to the ‘Upload’ area
  3. Select ‘skt-maintenance.zip’ from your computer
  4. Click ‘Install Now’
  5. Activate the plugin in the Plugin dashboard

Using FTP

  1. Download ‘skt-maintenance.zip’
  2. Extract the ‘skt-maintenance’ directory to your computer
  3. Upload the ‘skt-maintenance’ directory to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory
  4. Activate the plugin in the Plugin’s dashboard
sections.faq:
It seems like plugin is not working properly, even it is activated already?

Activate the maintenance mode by navigating to plugin settings and then try to access website in various browsers, you will be able to see the website in normal mode if you are logged as a WordPress user.

Who will be able to view your website even when it is under construction?

The visitor who had login can only view the website even when it is under construction. And the person who is logged out will only be able to see the maintenance mode page or a coming soon page. What your logged-out visitor will see depends on the mode that you have chosen.

Why the coming soon page still shows even when the plugin has been deactivated

This is a problem with caching. You can clear the cache by visiting the caching plugin’s settings page.
